data.Author: Justin Lilly <justin@justinlilly.com>
data.message:
Ubuntu isn't happy with the -Wall command to /usr/bin/env python

Returns no such file or directory. I think this may have to do with passing arguments
to /usr/bin/env, as it is interpreting the arguments for itself, not for python.
Providing a -- in between didn't help things either.

data.Author: Jacob Kaplan-Moss <jacob@jacobian.org>
data.message:
Added initial Haystack integration.

I'm using a throwaway object (Document) since it's the path of least resistance
to getting search working. The basic idea I'm following here is the one Eric
Holscher developed for Read The Docs -- see
http://ericholscher.com/blog/2010/nov/17/using-haystack-index-non-database-content/.

data.Author: Jacob Kaplan-Moss <jacob@jacobian.org>
data.message:
Added some code to read data from our Trac db.

This introduces some models; they were initially generated with inspectdb and
then editied by hand for a while. See the docstring in
django_website/trac/models.py for details.

There's also a db router to make sure that the Trac models get accessed through
the Trac DB correctly.

This is all very rough at the moment, and somewhat constrained by Django's
lack of composite primary key support. But it works for reading data, and
that's enough to start moving forward with it.

data.Author: Baptiste Mispelon <bmispelon@gmail.com>
data.message:
Improved the documentation search form and view.

The search form was designed so that, in the absence of a release ID,
it would yield search results corresponding to the current stable version.

However, there was a bug in the displaying of the form in that
the current release was not selected in the widget.

Another issue is that it was possible to trigger a 500 error by
passing an inexistant release ID to the page.

This commit fixes both those issues and a 404 is now raised when
passing an invalid release ID to the page.

data.Author: Baptiste Mispelon <bmispelon@gmail.com>
data.message:
Propagate the fragment identifier in *all* versions (not just dev).

In d48b79618d5d9d50032cc1b585b10e9dd6958044, I added the ability
of the apge to track the fragment identifier in the URL so that
switching between version would preserve it.

However, I overlooked the fact that the block of code I used
was only executed when viewing the dev version of the docs.

This commit makes the fragement identifier tracking available
for all version.

data.Author: Baptiste Mispelon <bmispelon@gmail.com>
data.message:
Improved the propagation of URL fragment identifiers between versions.

The commit introduced in da114303d06f413bda604b363c64e07c32b6bee0
only worked if the user didn't navigate to another fragment
after the page had loaded.

With this new approach, the fragment is added to the version
swticher at the last moment which ensures it is up-to-date.

data.message:
Fix issue #122 - Replace static community stats with actual data.

The data comes from people.djangoproject.com and djangopackages.com and is cached for 12 hours.

This also conditionally enables the page caching middleware during development to be able to use the locmem cache backend.

Thanks to @brutasse for merging https://github.com/brutasse/djangopeople/pull/54 and to @pydanny for being awesome and already providing that data via the Django packages API.

data.Author: Philip Neustrom <philipn@gmail.com>
data.message:
-moz-osx-font-smoothing for Firefox font smoothing support.

-moz-osx-font-smoothing is the analog of -webkit-font-smoothing in
Firefox in OS X (where it's most needed).  This change adds support for
-moz-osx-font-smoothing where -webkit-font-smoothing is currently used.

data.Author: Jannis Leidel <jannis@leidel.info>
data.message:
Added a non-permanent redirect for /overview/.

This tries to overcome the fact that there was permanent redirect set up in the database that went from `/overview/` to `https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/intro/overview/`.

Since permanent redirects are cached in browsers all we can do is at least provide the redirect for those who have bookmarked that page and come back after they've reset their browser.

For the rest we have to move that page to a different URL endpoint. I choose `/start/overview/` in the hope that there will be more "start" pages at some point.

data.Author: Jannis Leidel <jannis@leidel.info>
data.message:
Merge pull request #236 from django/overview-redirect

Added a non-permanent redirect for /overview/.

data.message:
Set require.js config before loading the main script.

This does a few things:

- it automatically falls back to the local version of jQuery if the CDN can't be reached (great for local development)
- it defines which the the mod files to load when using the cache busting file names (great for being able to set the expire to max for static files)

data.Author: Jannis Leidel <jannis@leidel.info>
data.message:
Big refactor that combines www and docs.

This was somewhat triggered by #229 since it showed that the hybrid project layout for www and docs was arbitrary and not conductive for ease of contribution.

- this introduces django-hosts for true host level URL reversal
- adds /400/, /403/, /404/ and /500/ pages fro testing the error pages
- fixes #229 by cleaning up the header and footer includers between hosts
- uses URL reversal everywhere
- renames the "project" to "djangoproject"
- splits the settings into prod and dev for easier separation of settings without
- moved static, templates and project fixtures into project dir

data.message:
Serve our own Fira Mono. Refs #310.

This has been documented here https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/19257#issuecomment-66950412 and basically boils down to Google Webfont looking for locally installed versions of Fire Mono first. And this won't be a sensible idea unless you are running Firefox OS which is an edge case at the moment or Arch with a package that contains Fira Mono another edge case.

data.message:
Improve error handling in payment form.

- raise a new DonationError for:
  - invalid card
  - some kind of error querying the Stripe API (e.g. reuse of stripe token)
  - broken network connection to Stripe API

- let errors bubble up:
  - auth tokens are wrong (we've changed them?)
  - other stripe errors and general exceptions

- improved frontend help for payment form
- stop passing fixed_amount to template since it's unused

data.Author: Jannis Leidel <jannis@leidel.info>
data.message:
Revamp document search.

This uses Elasticsearch and is vastly better than the old one. Here are some features:

- sensible full text search with a simpe syntax for querying documents
- per language and version search
- breadcrumbs to parent documents under each search result for deeply nested documents
- browser bar integration via OpenSearch description
- better styled pagination
- faster indexing
- press / to focus the search input
- improved search result page sidebar with links like on regular documentation pages
- cleaned up template tags and some other code

Fixes #423, #409, #279, #245, #244, #240 and #284.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Move payment details to separate model.

This enables us to properly record multiple payments for a recurring
donation.

Refs #386.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Admin for Payment changes.

Refs #386.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Use amounts from correct place in forms/templates.

When referring to the recurring value, use Donation.subscription_amount;
for the value of an individual payment, use Payment.amount.

Create the payment object when form is saved.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Fix tests after payments move.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Null subscriptions should not appear as recurring.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Handle payment webhook calls.

Stripe will send an "invoice.payment_succeeded" event when a regular
payment is made as part of a subscription. This change adds a generic
webhook handler and specific code to create a Payment in response to
this event.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Handle subscription.deleted webhook.

Remove the subscription_id from the Donation and send a confirmation
mail.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Handle payment failed webhook.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Add update card functionality.

If a card used for a recurring payment expires, Stripe will send a
payment_failed message. We then need some method for the user to update
the subscription with new card details.

This change adds an 'change card details' button to the manage_donations
page which displays a Stripe checkout form and updates the card attached
to the subscription.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Fix lint issues, use dash in URL.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Remove donation shuffle test.

The shuffling functionality and the utils file that provided it were
removed in cc28952, but the test remained and was broken because of the
missing file. Removing the test altogether.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Add total_payments method, simplify tests.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Blank subscription_amount for oneoff payments.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Style fixes.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Amounts in the API are in cents, not dollars.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Request event from Stripe on receiving webhook.

For security, we need to be sure that any event we receive really is
coming from Stripe. So when we receive a webhook post, we immediately
request it by ID from Stripe itself, and only process the data we
receive in response.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Style change card button, tidy up template and JS.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Remove nonexistent variable from mail templates.

Also test full URL is correctly reversed.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message: Guard against invalid JSON.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Disable Submit button during Ajax processing.

Currently, there is a significant delay between closing the Stripe
checkout form and the page being submitted, while the Ajax code runs.
This is potentially confusing for the user since there is no feedback
that anything is happening. This change adds a visible state change to
the Submit button so that the user is not tempted to click it again.

data.Author: Daniel Roseman <daniel.roseman@digital.cabinet-office.gov.uk>
data.message:
Remove null=True from CharFields.

Model changes and migration, plus some logic changes to set cancelled
subscription IDs to the empty string rather than None.

Also add a test for cancelling donations.

data.Author: Aymeric Augustin <aymeric.augustin@m4x.org>
data.message:
Remove unneeded fields from DocumentRelease.

All current objects have the same values in these fields. Furthermore
the code already makes assumptions about these values e.g. that scm_url
contains 'django.git'. Remove them to avoid giving the illusion of more
flexiblity than there is in practice.

data.Author: Aymeric Augustin <aymeric.augustin@m4x.org>
data.message:
Use Release.(eol_)date to determine active releases.

Move all the logic for figuring out which releases exhibit various
properties to the manager, simplifying the view vastly.

Make the code compatible with the upcoming 2.0 version.

Make Release.date nullable to allow creating releases before their date
is known. We need this to publish documentation for preview versions.

data.message:
Cleaned up the updated_docs command

By moving a chunk of logic from the command to a method
on DocumentRelease, it makes the code a bit more readable
and more testable too.
The ElasticSearch indexing was removed from that command
and now needs to be done in a separate step by calling
the update_index command (with the --delete flag).

to run two management commands sequentially.

data.Author: Sasha Romijn <github@mxsasha.eu>
data.message:
Removed requirement for actions to be taken by CoC committee chair.

In practice, the CoC committee has a rotating role for who should
send messages or take other actions. This has proven to be effective,
helps distribute the workload, and distributes experience.

data.Author: Sasha Romijn <github@mxsasha.eu>
data.message:
Adjusted CoC committee reporting requirements.

I see no purpose in reporting to the Django core team, and in fact
no team by that name currently even exist in the community.

For reporting to the board, this change adds an exception for cases
where the CoC incident involved a member of the board.

data.Author: Sasha Romijn <github@mxsasha.eu>
data.message: Added process for reports about CoC committee members.

data.Author: Sasha Romijn <github@mxsasha.eu>
data.message:
Changed working group to committee in CoC enforcement manual.

There is actually no working group, the group is a committee,
so this language was slightly confusing.
